title: Experiment: Water Delivery Method for Dairy Calves
text:
Background
Analysis of 35 peer-reviewed studies comparing individual vs group housing systems, assessing health, growth, and behavioral outcomes in dairy calves.




Goals

Compare weight gain patterns
Assess social behavior development
Evaluate disease transmission risks





Results

15% ↑ social interactions in groups
No significant difference in disease rates
Improved feed efficiency in groups

View Publication





Growth Rate Comparison

Group-housed calves showed more consistent weight gain after weaning period (p < 0.05).


Social Interaction Analysis

Increased play behavior observed in group housing systems.



Skills Used:

R Metafor
PRISMA
Python
Tableau
JBI Checklist

title: Meta-analysis: Calves in Group Housing
text:
View Publication







Background
Dairy calves are traditionally separated from dams shortly after birth and raised individually during the preweaning period. While this practice is common, it contrasts with natural social dynamics and raises welfare concerns. Social isolation can lead to stress, fearfulness, and reduced cognitive development. Group housing (pairs or small groups) has emerged as a potential alternative, but its effects on performance, health, and behavior remain inconsistently reported across studies.




Goals

Assess how group housing impacts performance, health, and behavior compared to individual housing of dairy calves
Investigate housing factors that may influence the outcomes of group housing for dairy calves
Synthesize findings to support practical improvements in calf-rearing systems





Results

Group-housed calves had higher average daily gain (ADG) (+0.06 kg/d, P = 0.001) and weaning weight (+1.44 kg, P = 0.037)
More active behaviors (feeding, playing) and fewer stress-related behaviors (self-grooming, pen interactions) in group-housed calves
Limited data on robust health outcomes (e.g., disease incidence)






Flowchart of the systematic collection and screening of articles

The process to identify and screen articles for eligibility and inclusion in this systematic review and meta-analysis.


Subgroup analysis of weaning age on average daily gain of dairy calves

Different weaning ages have different effects on the average daily gain of dairy calves.


Forest plot of the effects of group size on average daily gain of dairy calves

Studies on pair-housed calves show a higher average daily gain compared to individually housed calves.



Skills Used:

R
Excel
Data Collection
PRISMA
Systematic Review
Meta-analysis
Data Visualization

title: João Pedro Donadio
text:
jp.donadio@gmail.com
LinkedIn
GitHub
ORCID



Hi, I’m João Pedro Donadio — an Agricultural Engineer and Research Data Analyst passionate about turning raw data into meaningful insights. I am specialized in bridging the gap between fieldwork and analytics, helping researchers and decision-makers make informed, data-driven choices.
My toolbox includes SQL, R, statistical modeling, Quarto, MS Office (Excel, Word, Powerpoint…), and Canva. I’m also comfortable with version control on GitHub to ensure clean and collaborative workflows.
Driven by a deep curiosity about how systems work, I bring a unique blend of technical rigor and hands-on field experience. With a background in sustainable livestock farming and applied research, I focus on practical solutions for real-world challenges.




I’m here to help you connect science and strategy by:

Designing rigorous studies with clear, actionable objectives
Collecting and cleaning data from diverse sources
Uncovering patterns through robust statistical analysis
Creating intuitive visualizations that bring stories to life
Delivering dynamic reports for intelligent decision-making











“Data alone isn’t enough, it must be analysed deeply, visualized clearly, and communicated effectively to drive meaningful decisions.”




Want to know more? Access my CV

Olá, eu sou João Pedro Donadio - Engenheiro Agrônomo e Analista de Dados de Pesquisa apaixonado por transformar dados brutos em insights significativos. Sou especializado em fazer a ponte entre o trabalho de campo e a análise de dados, ajudando pesquisadores e gestores a tomar decisões embasadas em dados.
Minhas ferramentas incluem R, SQL, modelagem estatística, Tableau, Quarto, PowerPoint e Canva. Também trabalho com controle de versão no GitHub para garantir fluxos de trabalho limpos e colaborativos.
Movido por uma profunda curiosidade sobre como os sistemas funcionam, trago uma combinação única de rigor técnico e experiência prática de campo. Com formação em pecuária sustentável e pesquisa aplicada, foco em soluções práticas para desafios do mundo real.




Estou aqui para ajudá-lo a conectar ciência e estratégia através de:

Planejamento rigoroso de estudos com objetivos claros e acionáveis
Coleta e limpeza de dados de diversas fontes
Identificação de padrões através de análise estatística robusta
Criação de visualizações intuitivas que contam histórias
Elaboração de relatórios dinâmicos para tomada de decisão inteligente











“Dados por si só não são suficientes, eles precisam ser analisados profundamente, visualizados claramente e comunicados efetivamente para impulsionar decisões significativas.”

title: Medicare problem - TidyTuesday
text:
Background
Emergency room wait times vary significantly across the United States depending on factors such as hospital resources, patient volume, and staffing levels, with some states facing delays that can stretch for more than three hours.


Questions

Is there a connection between state populations and wait times?

Which conditions have the longest wait times? The shortest?




---- Compiling #TidyTuesday Information for 2025-04-08 ----

title: Experimento: Método de Fornecimento de Água para Bezerros Leiteiros
text: project_page

title: Meta-análise: Bezerros em Alojamento Coletivo
text:
Contexto
Análise de 35 estudos revisados por pares comparando sistemas individuais versus coletivos, avaliando saúde, crescimento e comportamentos em bezerros leiteiros.




Objetivos

Comparar padrões de ganho de peso
Avaliar desenvolvimento de comportamento social
Analisar riscos de transmissão de doenças





Resultados

15% ↑ interações sociais em grupos
Nenhuma diferença significativa em taxas de doença
Melhor eficiência alimentar em grupos

Ver Publicação





Comparação de Taxa de Crescimento

Bezerros em grupo mostraram ganho de peso mais consistente após desmame (p < 0.05).


Análise de Interação Social

Aumento de comportamentos lúdicos observado em sistemas coletivos.



Habilidades Utilizadas:

R Metafor
PRISMA
Python
Tableau
Checklist JBI
